original: @58b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @58b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: krishna la n'a ri s'a dha na pro ta phul la ku mu d'a n'a ma /
analyzed: krishna la n'a ri s'a dha na pro ta phul la ku mu d'a n'a ma /
translated: Kṛṣṇayamāri-sādhana-prabhāvatīkumudottara-nāma

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: gshin rje'i dgra nag po'i sgrub pa'i thabs ku mu da kha bye ba zhes bya ba /
analyzed: gshin rje'i dgra nag po'i sgrub pa'i thabs ku mu da kha bye ba zhes bya ba /
translated: The Black Yamāri Sādhana Called “The Blooming Kumuda”

original: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //🔽'bar ba'i 'od zer phreng 'khrugs pas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo // 'bar ba'i 'od zer phreng 'khrugs pas //
translated: Homage to the Buddha.🔽With a garland of blazing light🔽rays, the enemy of Yama,

original: 'gro ba'i mun sel gshin rje'i dgra //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i mun sel gshin rje'i dgra //
translated: who removes the darkness of the world,

original: rab snang btsun mo dga' mdzad la //
analyzed: rab snang btsun mo dga' mdzad la //
translated: having bowed to the one who delights the queen,

original: btud nas de yi sgrub thabs bshad //
analyzed: btud nas de yi sgrub thabs bshad //
translated: I will explain his sādhana.

original: dang po re zhig sngags pas stan bde ba la nye bar 'dug ste /
analyzed: dang po re zhig sngags pas stan bde ba la nye bar 'dug ste /
translated: First, the mantrin should sit on a comfortable seat

original: rang gi snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor rnam par bsams la /
analyzed: rang gi snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor rnam par bsams la /
translated: and imagine a moon maṇḍala in his heart.

original: de'i steng du yi ge yam sngon po blta'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du yi ge yam sngon po blta'o //
translated: On top of that, he should see the blue syllable yaṃ.

original: de ma thag tu byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang btang snyoms rnam par bsgoms te /
analyzed: de ma thag tu byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang btang snyoms rnam par bsgoms te /
translated: Immediately, he should meditate on love, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: de'i 'og tu snying ga'i yi ge yam las skyes pa'i 'od zer @59a * //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu snying ga'i yi ge yam las skyes pa'i 'od zer @59a * //
translated: After that, from the syllable yaṃ in the heart, light rays

original: rnams kyis / bla ma dang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / dpal gshin rje'i dgra nam mkha' la snang bar byas la /
analyzed: rnams kyis / bla ma dang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / dpal gshin rje'i dgra nam mkha' la snang bar byas la /
translated: All the Gurus, Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, and glorious Yamantakas appear in the sky.

original: de rnams la mngon par 'dud pa dang / mchod pa dang mdun du sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang ; de yongs su bsngo ba dang / gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / smon pa byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa dang /
analyzed: de rnams la mngon par 'dud pa dang / mchod pa dang mdun du sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang ; de yongs su bsngo ba dang / gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / smon pa byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa dang /
translated: Bowing to them, making offerings, confessing sins in their presence, rejoicing in merit, dedicating merit, going for refuge to the Three Jewels, generating the aspiration to enlightenment,

original: rgyal ba'i lam la brten pa dang / 'jug pa byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / slar gtang ba'i bar du bsgrub po //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i lam la brten pa dang / 'jug pa byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / slar gtang ba'i bar du bsgrub po //
translated: taking the vow of the Conqueror's path, generating the engaging awakening mind, and practicing up to the point of not giving up on it.

original: de nas yang rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dran pas stong pa nyid bsgoms la /🔽aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: de nas yang rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dran pas stong pa nyid bsgoms la / aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
translated: Then, recalling the three gates of liberation, meditate on emptiness.

original: zhes bya ba'i sngags brjod de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sngags brjod de /
translated: Recite the mantra:🔽Oṃ śūnyatā jñāna vajra svabhāva ātmako 'ham.

original: 'di ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpal gshin rje'i dgra skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpal gshin rje'i dgra skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: This generates the glorious Yama, the accumulation of merit and wisdom.

original: de bzhin du rang bzhin gyi lus dang ngag dang yid dag / aom a'a: h'um zhes pa'i yi ge gsum pha dang ma'i dbus na gnas pa steng du zla ba la gnas pa bsam mo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang bzhin gyi lus dang ngag dang yid dag / aom a'a: h'um zhes pa'i yi ge gsum pha dang ma'i dbus na gnas pa steng du zla ba la gnas pa bsam mo //
translated: Likewise, the natural body, speech, and mind are the three syllables oṃ āḥ hūṃ located in the middle of the father and mother, imagined to be on the moon above.

original: mdun du nyi ma la gnas pa'i h'um nag po las byung ba'i rdo rje nga po 'bar ba las /
analyzed: mdun du nyi ma la gnas pa'i h'um nag po las byung ba'i rdo rje nga po 'bar ba las /
translated: From a black hūṃ on a sun in front, a blazing one-tined vajra arises.

original: rdo rje'i sa gzhi dang dra ba dang gur rnams bsgom par bya zhing /
analyzed: rdo rje'i sa gzhi dang dra ba dang gur rnams bsgom par bya zhing /
translated: One should meditate on the vajra ground, enclosure, and tent.

original: bgegs med pa'i sems kyis dbus su sna tshogs padma dang zla ba la gnas pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' yongs su gyur pa las chos kyi 'byung gnas dbus na pam las byung ba'i padma sna tshogs dang / kham las byung ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje can bsams te /
analyzed: bgegs med pa'i sems kyis dbus su sna tshogs padma dang zla ba la gnas pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' yongs su gyur pa las chos kyi 'byung gnas dbus na pam las byung ba'i padma sna tshogs dang / kham las byung ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje can bsams te /
translated: With a mind free of obstacles, in the center, on a multicolored lotus and moon, is Vajrasattva, who completely transforms into a multicolored lotus and vajra cross arising from paṃ and khaṃ in the center of the source of phenomena.

original: de'i zla ba la yi ge bhr'um las byung ba'i 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa yi ge bhr'um gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i zla ba la yi ge bhr'um las byung ba'i 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa yi ge bhr'um gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: In its center, from the syllable bhrūṃ, is an eight-spoked wheel consecrated by the syllable bhrūṃ.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa'i rnam par snang mdzad rig ma dang bcas pa'i yan lag las byung ba'i khang pa brtsegs pa /🔽gru bzhi sgo bzhi pa /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa'i rnam par snang mdzad rig ma dang bcas pa'i yan lag las byung ba'i khang pa brtsegs pa / gru bzhi sgo bzhi pa /
translated: That completely transforms into Vairocana with his knowledge consort, and from their union emerges a multistoried palace.🔽It has four sides and four gates.

original: rta babs bzhi dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rta babs bzhi dang ldan pa /
translated: It has four pediments.

original: dra ba dang dra ba phyed pas mdzes pa /
analyzed: dra ba dang dra ba phyed pas mdzes pa /
translated: It is beautified by nets and half-nets.

original: sna tshogs pa'i rgyan gnas pa /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i rgyan gnas pa /
translated: It is adorned with various ornaments.

original: sna tshogs rdo rje la brten pa'i sna tshogs padma la zla ba dang nyi mas mnan pa bcu bdun gyis mdzes pa rnam par bsgom mo //
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rje la brten pa'i sna tshogs padma la zla ba dang nyi mas mnan pa bcu bdun gyis mdzes pa rnam par bsgom mo //
translated: It is beautified by sixteen moons and suns on a multicolored lotus supported by a multicolored vajra cross.

original: de'i dbus su zla ba'i gdan la gnas pa'i yi ge gsum la gzigs nas byon pa'i sangs rgyas rnams /
analyzed: de'i dbus su zla ba'i gdan la gnas pa'i yi ge gsum la gzigs nas byon pa'i sangs rgyas rnams /
translated: In its center, on a moon seat, are the three syllables oṃ āḥ hūṃ.

original: dbyangs bcu drug dang ya ra la wa da dha lhag pa'i gsal byed bzhi bcu'i gzugs nyis 'gyur du byas pa byon nas /
analyzed: dbyangs bcu drug dang ya ra la wa da dha lhag pa'i gsal byed bzhi bcu'i gzugs nyis 'gyur du byas pa byon nas /
translated: The buddhas who have come to see them are in the form of the sixteen vowels and the forty-two consonants, doubled.

original: @59b rim pa bzhin 'og dang steng du zla ba gnyis su gyur par bya ba ni /
analyzed: @59b rim pa bzhin 'og dang steng du zla ba gnyis su gyur par bya ba ni /
translated: The two moons below and above, respectively, are to be made into two moons.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
translated: This is the mirror-like primordial wisdom.

original: zla ba gnyis dang yi ge gsum 'dres pas gang ba'i zla ba gsum du gyur pa ni mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis dang yi ge gsum 'dres pas gang ba'i zla ba gsum du gyur pa ni mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The three moons filled with the three syllables mixed with the two moons is the primordial wisdom of equality.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las yi ge h'um dkar pos mtshan pa'i rdo rje bsams te /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las yi ge h'um dkar pos mtshan pa'i rdo rje bsams te /
translated: From that transformation, one should imagine a vajra marked with a white syllable hūṃ.

original: aom badzra a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: aom badzra a'atma ko& ham /
translated: oṃ vajra ātmāko ’haṃ

original: zhes ngar 'dzin pa ni so sor rtog pa'o //🔽yi ge h'um las byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs par byas te /
analyzed: zhes ngar 'dzin pa ni so sor rtog pa'o // yi ge h'um las byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs par byas te /
translated: The pride of “I am” is discerning primordial wisdom.🔽The tathāgatas who arise from the syllable hūṃ make all sentient beings into tathāgatas.

original: yi ge h'um gi nang du son pa dang / aom ya th'a sarba ta th'a ga t'a ta th'a aa ham /
analyzed: yi ge h'um gi nang du son pa dang / aom ya th'a sarba ta th'a ga t'a ta th'a aa ham /
translated: They enter into the syllable hūṃ, and one should have the pride of “I am all tathāgatas” with oṃ yathā sarvatathāgatās tathāhaṃ.

original: zhes nga rgyal bya ba ni bya ba grub pa'o ;
analyzed: zhes nga rgyal bya ba ni bya ba grub pa'o ;
translated: This is the primordial wisdom of accomplishing activities.

original: / yi ge h'um las byung ba'i 'od zer rnams kyis rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bskul te /
analyzed: / yi ge h'um las byung ba'i 'od zer rnams kyis rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bskul te /
translated: The light rays that arise from the syllable hūṃ invoke the tathāgatas, who have the form of Vajrasattva.

original: h'um la zhugs pa dang h'um dang rdo rjer bcas pa yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i rdo rje sems dpa' khro ba sgeg pa'i nyams can /
analyzed: h'um la zhugs pa dang h'um dang rdo rjer bcas pa yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i rdo rje sems dpa' khro ba sgeg pa'i nyams can /
translated: He enters into hūṃ, and the hūṃ together with the vajra completely transform into angry Vajrasattva with a playful expression.

original: g-yas brkyang ba /
analyzed: g-yas brkyang ba /
translated: He stands with his right leg straight

original: rtsa ba'i zhal dang sku thams cad dkar ba /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i zhal dang sku thams cad dkar ba /
translated: and his main face and entire body are white.

original: zhal g-yas g-yon sngo ba dang dmar ba /
analyzed: zhal g-yas g-yon sngo ba dang dmar ba /
translated: His right and left faces are blue and red.

original: phyag dang po g-yas dang g-yon gyis gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin pas rang dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma la 'khyud pa /
analyzed: phyag dang po g-yas dang g-yon gyis gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin pas rang dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma la 'khyud pa /
translated: His first right and left hands hold a flaying knife and skull cup, embracing a wisdom consort similar to himself.

original: phyag lhag ma rnams ni rdo rje dang ral gri dang / 'khor lo dang padma bsnams pa /
analyzed: phyag lhag ma rnams ni rdo rje dang ral gri dang / 'khor lo dang padma bsnams pa /
translated: His remaining hands hold a vajra, sword, chakram, and lotus.

original: dbu rgyan du mi bskyod pas mnan pa /
analyzed: dbu rgyan du mi bskyod pas mnan pa /
translated: Akṣobhya crowns his head.

original: 'di ltar bdag nyid bsgom pa ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag nyid bsgom pa ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Thus, meditating on oneself in this way is the pure realm of phenomena.

original: 'di ni dpal gshin rje'i dgra sgo ngar 'jug pa rab tu bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dpal gshin rje'i dgra sgo ngar 'jug pa rab tu bsgom pa'o //
translated: This is the meditation on the entrance into the gateway of glorious Yamarī.

original: de nas rang gi ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon las byung ba'i 'od zer gyis 'gro ba thams cad sangs rgyas su byas pa drangs te /
analyzed: de nas rang gi ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon las byung ba'i 'od zer gyis 'gro ba thams cad sangs rgyas su byas pa drangs te /
translated: Then, light rays from the seed syllable of the gnosis being of oneself draw forth all transmigrators and make them buddhas.

original: rang gi lus la gzhug go //
analyzed: rang gi lus la gzhug go //
translated: They are brought into one’s body.

original: de'i 'og tu yi ge gsum pha dang ma'i dbus na gnas pa dri za'i sems can lta bur rang gi kha nas zhugs te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yi ge gsum pha dang ma'i dbus na gnas pa dri za'i sems can lta bur rang gi kha nas zhugs te /
translated: After that, the three syllables, abiding in the middle of the father and mother, like gandharva sentient beings, enter one’s mouth.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi rnam pa rdo rje'i lam nas byung ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi rnam pa rdo rje'i lam nas byung ste /
translated: They emerge from the vajra path in the aspect of bodhicitta.

original: rang gi rig ma'i padmar lhung ba dang / de las byung ba'i 'od zer dmar pos de la reg pas rig ma 'dod chags chen pos zhu zhing /
analyzed: rang gi rig ma'i padmar lhung ba dang / de las byung ba'i 'od zer dmar pos de la reg pas rig ma 'dod chags chen pos zhu zhing /
translated: The red light rays that emerge from that touch it, and the knowledge consort melts through great passion.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang zhu bar blta'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang zhu bar blta'o //
translated: See the Bhagavat also melting.

original: zhu ba'i sgo nga las byung ba'i tsa rtsi k'a la sogs pa bzhi rang rang gi stan la 'khod pas /
analyzed: zhu ba'i sgo nga las byung ba'i tsa rtsi k'a la sogs pa bzhi rang rang gi stan la 'khod pas /
translated: The four, Caṇḍālī and so on, who emerge from the melted egg, sit on their respective seats.

original: bcom ldan 'das mi bzhugs par mthong bas //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mi bzhugs par mthong bas //
translated: Seeing that the Bhagavat is not present,

original: yid mi dga' bas @60a * //
analyzed: yid mi dga' bas @60a * //
translated: they are displeased.

original: mgrin pa gshibs te /
analyzed: mgrin pa gshibs te /
translated: With their throats crossed,

original: slong ba'i glus 'di ltar bskul lo //
analyzed: slong ba'i glus 'di ltar bskul lo //
translated: they supplicate with this song of supplication:

original: rje btsun thugs rjes khro ba bzhengs mdzod la //
analyzed: rje btsun thugs rjes khro ba bzhengs mdzod la //
translated: Arise, O Lord, with wrathful compassion!

original: jo bo da ring bdud las rgyal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: jo bo da ring bdud las rgyal ba'i phyir //
translated: O Lord, today, for the sake of victory over Mara,

original: srid gsum kun gyi gti mug mthar mdzod cig //
analyzed: srid gsum kun gyi gti mug mthar mdzod cig //
translated: bring to an end the delusion of the three worlds!

original: 'jig rten ma lus thugs kyi mgron pos nas //
analyzed: 'jig rten ma lus thugs kyi mgron pos nas //
translated: Having invited all the worlds to the feast of your mind,

original: stong pa nyid du ma bzhugs rje btsun bzhengs //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du ma bzhugs rje btsun bzhengs //
translated: do not remain in emptiness, O Lord, arise!

original: 'jig rten bsod nams bya ba'i ched du ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten bsod nams bya ba'i ched du ni //
translated: For the sake of the world's meritorious deeds,

original: stong pa nyid du ma bzhugs rje btsun bzhengs //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du ma bzhugs rje btsun bzhengs //
translated: do not remain in emptiness, O Lord, arise!

original: byang chub dngos la 'jig rten mgron pos na //
analyzed: byang chub dngos la 'jig rten mgron pos na //
translated: Having invited the world to the feast of enlightenment,

original: cis na bsam pa mi mnga' rje btsun bzhengs //
analyzed: cis na bsam pa mi mnga' rje btsun bzhengs //
translated: why do you not think of it, O Lord, arise!

original: de ma thag tu tsa rtsi k'a la sogs pa sgo nga la zhugs shing zhugs ma thag tu /
analyzed: de ma thag tu tsa rtsi k'a la sogs pa sgo nga la zhugs shing zhugs ma thag tu /
translated: Immediately, CaurI and the others entered the eggs, and as soon as they had entered,

original: sgo nga yongs su gyur pa las /
analyzed: sgo nga yongs su gyur pa las /
translated: the eggs were transformed.

original: gshin rje'i dgra ma he'i steng nas sna tshogs padma nyi ma la g-yas brkyang bas gnas pa /
analyzed: gshin rje'i dgra ma he'i steng nas sna tshogs padma nyi ma la g-yas brkyang bas gnas pa /
translated: Yama, the enemy, was on the back of a water buffalo, standing on a multicolored lotus and sun, with his right leg extended.

original: zhal gsum phyag drug pa /
analyzed: zhal gsum phyag drug pa /
translated: He had three faces and six arms.

original: rtsa ba'i zhal dang sku mdog mthing nag / zhal g-yas dang g-yon dkar ba dang dmar ba /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i zhal dang sku mdog mthing nag / zhal g-yas dang g-yon dkar ba dang dmar ba /
translated: the right and left faces are white and red,

original: phyag rnams rdo rje sems dpa'i mtshan dang ldan pa /
analyzed: phyag rnams rdo rje sems dpa'i mtshan dang ldan pa /
translated: the hands have the characteristics of Vajrasattva,

original: rus pa'i rgyan gyis spras pa /🔽'od zer mthing ga'i phreng ba 'khrugs pa /
analyzed: rus pa'i rgyan gyis spras pa / 'od zer mthing ga'i phreng ba 'khrugs pa /
translated: adorned with bone ornaments,🔽agitated by a garland of blue light rays,

original: smin ma 'bar zhing khro gnyer gtsigs pa /
analyzed: smin ma 'bar zhing khro gnyer gtsigs pa /
translated: with eyebrows blazing and a frowning scowl,

original: phyag dang zhabs kyi sen mo rno ba /
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs kyi sen mo rno ba /
translated: with sharp fingernails and toenails,

original: gsus pa che ba /
analyzed: gsus pa che ba /
translated: with a large belly,

original: mi'u thung gi gzugs can /
analyzed: mi'u thung gi gzugs can /
translated: having the form of a dwarf,

original: skra kham pa gyen du brdzes pa /
analyzed: skra kham pa gyen du brdzes pa /
translated: with tawny hair bristling upward,

original: klu chen po mthong ba'i dug chen phu: zhes zer ba rnams kyis yan lag rnam par brgyan pa /
analyzed: klu chen po mthong ba'i dug chen phu: zhes zer ba rnams kyis yan lag rnam par brgyan pa /
translated: adorned with the limbs of those who say, “The great nāga is the great poison of sight.”

original: 'di ltar bdag nyid rnam par bsams pa'i 'og tu bdag nyid la chu'i nang gi zla ba ltar bskyod pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag nyid rnam par bsams pa'i 'og tu bdag nyid la chu'i nang gi zla ba ltar bskyod pas /
translated: Having thus visualized oneself, one should recite:

original: aom dharma dh'a tu sva wa a'atma ko& ham /🔽zhes bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: aom dharma dh'a tu sva wa a'atma ko& ham / zhes bzlas par bya'o //
translated: “Oṃ, dharmadhātu svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ.

original: 'di ni dpal gshin rje'i dgra sgo nga las byung ba'i sgrub pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: 'di ni dpal gshin rje'i dgra sgo nga las byung ba'i sgrub pa'i thabs so //
translated: This is the sādhana of Śrī Yama born from an egg.

original: de nas rang gi sa bon las byung ba'i 'od zer gyis sangs rgyas thams cad spyan drangs te /
analyzed: de nas rang gi sa bon las byung ba'i 'od zer gyis sangs rgyas thams cad spyan drangs te /
translated: Then light rays arise from one's seed syllable, inviting all buddhas.

original: rang gi kha nas zhugs pa dang / rdo rje'i lam nas song ste /
analyzed: rang gi kha nas zhugs pa dang / rdo rje'i lam nas song ste /
translated: They enter one's mouth and go through the vajra path.

original: shes rab ma'i padmar gnas pa'i gong bu las /
analyzed: shes rab ma'i padmar gnas pa'i gong bu las /
translated: From the sphere abiding in the lotus of the wisdom consort,

original: zhes sdang rdo rje dang / gti mug rdo rje dang / ser sna rdo rje dang / 'dod chags rdo rje dang / phrag dog rdo rje rnams ya dang kshe dang ma dang me dang da rnams kyi sa bon las spro zhing /
analyzed: zhes sdang rdo rje dang / gti mug rdo rje dang / ser sna rdo rje dang / 'dod chags rdo rje dang / phrag dog rdo rje rnams ya dang kshe dang ma dang me dang da rnams kyi sa bon las spro zhing /
translated: one emanates Hatred Vajra from the seed ya, Delusion Vajra from the seed kṣe, Avarice Vajra from the seed ma, Passion Vajra from the seed me, and Jealousy Vajra from the seed da.

original: de bzhin du gong bu las byung ba'i sa bon ya dang tsa dang ni dang r'a dang dza dang sa dang / do dang ru rnams las tho ba dang / be con dang / padma dang / ral gri dang tsa rtsi k'a dang / phag mo dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du gong bu las byung ba'i sa bon ya dang tsa dang ni dang r'a dang dza dang sa dang / do dang ru rnams las tho ba dang / be con dang / padma dang / ral gri dang tsa rtsi k'a dang / phag mo dang /
translated: Similarly, from the sphere arise the seed ya, the seed ca, the seed ni, the seed ra, the seed ja, the seed sa, the seed do, and the seed ru. From them arise the hammer, the club, the lotus, the sword, Caṇḍālī, Vārāhī,

original: @60b dbyangs can ma dang / mdzod ldan ma rnams dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: @60b dbyangs can ma dang / mdzod ldan ma rnams dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: Sarasvatī, and Ghasmarī.

original: yang gong bu las byung ba'i sa bon /
analyzed: yang gong bu las byung ba'i sa bon /
translated: Again, from the sphere arise the seed ya, the seed ra, the seed la, the seed va, the seed śa, the seed ṣa, the seed sa, and the seed ha.

original: na dang yo dang ni dang r'a rnams las grva bzhir thod pa bzhi dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: na dang yo dang ni dang r'a rnams las grva bzhir thod pa bzhi dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: From the na, ya, ni, and ra, the four skull-cups should be drawn in the four corners.

original: de ni 'di ltar sa bon las rang rang gi stan gyi steng du rang rang gi rtsa ba'i mtshan ma des mtshan pa dbyung zhing de yongs su gyur pa las rang rang gi lus su gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar sa bon las rang rang gi stan gyi steng du rang rang gi rtsa ba'i mtshan ma des mtshan pa dbyung zhing de yongs su gyur pa las rang rang gi lus su gnas pa'o //
translated: Thus, from the seed syllables, one should draw the individual root signs on their individual seats, marked with those [signs]. From their complete transformation, one should abide in one's own body.

original: de nas rim pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de nas rim pa bzhin du /
translated: Then, in order,

original: aom hr'i: shtri: wi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom hr'i: shtri: wi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
translated: [recite] Oṃ hrīḥ ṣṭṛīḥ vikṛtānana hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā.

original: aom dzin dzik / aom ratna dhrik / aom a'a ro lika / aom par dzny'a dhrik / aom mung+ga'i ra dhrik / aom danda dhrik / aom padma dhrik / aom dve sha ra ti /
analyzed: aom dzin dzik / aom ratna dhrik / aom a'a ro lika / aom par dzny'a dhrik / aom mung+ga'i ra dhrik / aom danda dhrik / aom padma dhrik / aom dve sha ra ti /
translated: Oṃ jinajik, Oṃ ratnadhṛk, Oṃ ārolik, Oṃ parjñādhṛk, Oṃ muṅgīradhṛk, Oṃ dandadhṛk, Oṃ padmadhṛk, Oṃ dveśaratī,

original: aom mo ha ra ti /🔽aom r'a ga ra ti /
analyzed: aom mo ha ra ti / aom r'a ga ra ti /
translated: Oṃ moharatī,🔽Oṃ rāgaratī,

original: aom badzra r'a ti /
analyzed: aom badzra r'a ti /
translated: Oṃ vajraratī,

original: aom a'a: h'um zhes pa'i sngags rnams kyis sngar bshad pa'i lha rnams dang / thod pa bzhi spros te /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um zhes pa'i sngags rnams kyis sngar bshad pa'i lha rnams dang / thod pa bzhi spros te /
translated: Oṃ āḥ hūṃ. With these mantras, emanate the previously explained deities and the four skull-cups.

original: 'gro ba'i don byas nas /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don byas nas /
translated: Having performed the benefit of sentient beings,

original: rang re'i stan la sa bon las byung ba'i lus rnams la zhugs par blta'o //
analyzed: rang re'i stan la sa bon las byung ba'i lus rnams la zhugs par blta'o //
translated: One should view the bodies that arise from the seeds on one’s own seat as having entered into them.

original: da ni de dag gi gnas dang stan dang / kha dog dang / lag cha rnams bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni de dag gi gnas dang stan dang / kha dog dang / lag cha rnams bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now their abodes, seats, colors, and implements are to be explained.

original: dbus su ni nyi ma la zhe sdang rdo rje sngar bshad pa'i mdog dang lag cha'o //
analyzed: dbus su ni nyi ma la zhe sdang rdo rje sngar bshad pa'i mdog dang lag cha'o //
translated: In the center, on a sun, is Hatred Vajra, the color and implements as previously explained.

original: sna tshogs rdo rje'i shar phyogs su ni gti mug rdo rje zla ba la gnas pa dkar po /
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rje'i shar phyogs su ni gti mug rdo rje zla ba la gnas pa dkar po /
translated: In the east of the variegated vajra is Delusion Vajra, white, standing on a moon,

original: zhal gsum phyag drug pa /
analyzed: zhal gsum phyag drug pa /
translated: with three faces and six arms.

original: g-yas na 'khor lo dang / ral gri dang / g-yon na rin po che dang padma can no //
analyzed: g-yas na 'khor lo dang / ral gri dang / g-yon na rin po che dang padma can no //
translated: In the right hands he holds a wheel and a sword; in the left hands he holds a jewel and a lotus.

original: sna tshogs rdo rje'i lho'i cha la ni /
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rje'i lho'i cha la ni /
translated: In the southern part of the variegated vajra,

original: nyi ma la gnas pa'i ser sna rdo rje gser btso ma lta bu /
analyzed: nyi ma la gnas pa'i ser sna rdo rje gser btso ma lta bu /
translated: on a sun, is Greed Vajra, the color of refined gold,

original: zhal gsum phyag drug pa /
analyzed: zhal gsum phyag drug pa /
translated: with three faces and six arms.

original: g-yas na rin po che dang ral gri can /
analyzed: g-yas na rin po che dang ral gri can /
translated: In the right hands he holds a jewel and a sword;

original: g-yon dag na 'khor lo dang chu skyes 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon dag na 'khor lo dang chu skyes 'dzin pa'o //
translated: in the left hands he holds a wheel and a lotus.

original: sna tshogs rdo rje'i nub tu nyi mal 'dod chags rdo rje mdog dmar ba /
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rje'i nub tu nyi mal 'dod chags rdo rje mdog dmar ba /
translated: In the west of the variegated vajra, on a sun, is Passion Vajra, red,

original: zhal gsum phyag drug pa /
analyzed: zhal gsum phyag drug pa /
translated: He has three faces and six arms.

original: g-yas dag na padma dang ral gri can /
analyzed: g-yas dag na padma dang ral gri can /
translated: He holds a lotus and a sword in his right hands.

original: g-yon dag gis nor bu dang 'khor lo thogs pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon dag gis nor bu dang 'khor lo thogs pa'o //
translated: He holds a jewel and a chakram in his left hands.

original: sna tshogs rdo rje'i byang phyogs su nyi ma la gnas pa'i phrag dog rdo rje sku mdog ljang gu /
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rje'i byang phyogs su nyi ma la gnas pa'i phrag dog rdo rje sku mdog ljang gu /
translated: In the north of the variegated vajra, on a sun, is Jealousy Vajra, green,

original: zhal gsum phyag drug pa /🔽g-yas dag na ral gri dang 'khor lo 'dzin pa /
analyzed: zhal gsum phyag drug pa / g-yas dag na ral gri dang 'khor lo 'dzin pa /
translated: with three faces and six arms.🔽He holds a sword and a chakram in his right hands.

original: g-yon dag na nor bu dang padma 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon dag na nor bu dang padma 'dzin pa'o //
translated: He holds a jewel and a lotus in his left hands.

original: 'di rnams ni rtsa ba'i zhal sku dang 'dra ba /
analyzed: 'di rnams ni rtsa ba'i zhal sku dang 'dra ba /
translated: These have faces like the principal face.

original: zhal lhag ma dag 'chad par byed pa lta bu /
analyzed: zhal lhag ma dag 'chad par byed pa lta bu /
translated: The remaining faces are as if explaining.

original: phyag dang po gnyis thod pa gri gug dang bcas pa /🔽rang dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma la 'khyud pa 'dug stangs dang / rgyan thams cad zhe @61a * //
analyzed: phyag dang po gnyis thod pa gri gug dang bcas pa / rang dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma la 'khyud pa 'dug stangs dang / rgyan thams cad zhe @61a * //
translated: The first two hands hold a skull and a flaying knife.🔽He embraces a wisdom being similar to himself in the manner of embracing.

original: sdang rdo rje dang 'dra ba /
analyzed: sdang rdo rje dang 'dra ba /
translated: All the ornaments are as in Hatred Vajra.

original: sna tshogs padma la brten pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs padma la brten pa'o //
translated: He stands on a variegated lotus.

original: shar gyi sgor rdo rje tho ba mdog dkar ba /
analyzed: shar gyi sgor rdo rje tho ba mdog dkar ba /
translated: At the eastern gate is Vajra Hammer, white,

original: g-yas dag na tho ba dang ral gri //
analyzed: g-yas dag na tho ba dang ral gri //
translated: with a hammer and a sword in his right hands.

original: g-yon dag na nor bu dang padma'o //
analyzed: g-yon dag na nor bu dang padma'o //
translated: In the left hands are a jewel and lotus.

original: lhor rdo rje be con mdog ser po /
analyzed: lhor rdo rje be con mdog ser po /
translated: In the south is Vajra-gada, yellow,

original: g-yas dag na be con dang ral gri /
analyzed: g-yas dag na be con dang ral gri /
translated: with a club and sword in the right hands,

original: g-yon dag na padma dang 'khor lo 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon dag na padma dang 'khor lo 'dzin pa'o //
translated: and a lotus and wheel in the left hands.

original: nub tu rdo rje padma mdog dmar ba /
analyzed: nub tu rdo rje padma mdog dmar ba /
translated: In the west is Vajra-padma, red,

original: g-yas dag na padma dang ral gri / g-yon dag na nor bu dang 'khor lo can no //
analyzed: g-yas dag na padma dang ral gri / g-yon dag na nor bu dang 'khor lo can no //
translated: with a lotus and sword in the right hands, and a jewel and wheel in the left hands.

original: byang gi sgor rdo rje ral gri mdog ljang gu /
analyzed: byang gi sgor rdo rje ral gri mdog ljang gu /
translated: In the north is Vajra-khadga, green,

original: g-yas dag na ral gri dang 'khor lo can /
analyzed: g-yas dag na ral gri dang 'khor lo can /
translated: with a sword and wheel in the right hands,

original: g-yon dag na nor bu dang padma can no //
analyzed: g-yon dag na nor bu dang padma can no //
translated: and a jewel and lotus in the left hands.

original: 'di rnams ni sna tshogs padma'i nyi ma la bzhugs pa /
analyzed: 'di rnams ni sna tshogs padma'i nyi ma la bzhugs pa /
translated: They all stand on variegated lotus-sun seats,

original: zhal rnams 'chad par byed pa las rtsa ba'i zhal rang rang gi sku dang 'dra ba /
analyzed: zhal rnams 'chad par byed pa las rtsa ba'i zhal rang rang gi sku dang 'dra ba /
translated: with the faces as described, and the principal faces the same color as their bodies.

original: dang po'i phyag na gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin pas /
analyzed: dang po'i phyag na gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin pas /
translated: The first pair of hands hold a flaying knife and skull cup,

original: rang dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma la 'khyud pa /
analyzed: rang dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma la 'khyud pa /
translated: embracing a wisdom being similar to oneself.

original: shin tu 'jigs par byed pa'i gzugs can no //
analyzed: shin tu 'jigs par byed pa'i gzugs can no //
translated: They have extremely terrifying forms.

original: de bzhin du sna tshogs rdo rje'i shar lho'i mtshams su rdo rje tsa rtsi k'a sha chung ba mdog dkar ba /
analyzed: de bzhin du sna tshogs rdo rje'i shar lho'i mtshams su rdo rje tsa rtsi k'a sha chung ba mdog dkar ba /
translated: Likewise, in the southeast corner of the vajra cross is Vajra-Tsaraka, small, white,

original: g-yas dag na 'khor lo dang ral gri dang / g-yon dag na rin po che dang padma 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas dag na 'khor lo dang ral gri dang / g-yon dag na rin po che dang padma 'dzin pa'o //
translated: holding a wheel and sword in the right hands, and a jewel and lotus in the left hands.

original: lho nub tu rdo rje phag mo mdog ser ba /
analyzed: lho nub tu rdo rje phag mo mdog ser ba /
translated: In the southwest is Vajra-Varahi, yellow,

original: g-yas na rin po che dang ral gri 'dzin pa /
analyzed: g-yas na rin po che dang ral gri 'dzin pa /
translated: holding a jewel and sword in the right hands,

original: g-yon dag na 'khor lo dang padma 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon dag na 'khor lo dang padma 'dzin pa'o //
translated: and a wheel and lotus in the left hands.

original: nub byang du rdo rje dbyangs can ma mdog dmar mo g-yas dag na padma dang ral gri can /
analyzed: nub byang du rdo rje dbyangs can ma mdog dmar mo g-yas dag na padma dang ral gri can /
translated: In the northwest is Vajra-Sarasvati, red, holding a lotus and sword in the right hands,

original: g-yon dag na nor bu dang 'khor lo 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon dag na nor bu dang 'khor lo 'dzin pa'o //
translated: and a jewel and wheel in the left hands.

original: byang shar du rdo rje mdzod ldan ma mdog ljang gu g-yas dag na ral gri dang 'khor lo can /
analyzed: byang shar du rdo rje mdzod ldan ma mdog ljang gu g-yas dag na ral gri dang 'khor lo can /
translated: In the northeast is Vajra-Vasudhara, green, holding a sword and wheel in the right hands,

original: g-yon dag na nor bu dang padma 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon dag na nor bu dang padma 'dzin pa'o //
translated: and a jewel and lotus in the left hands.

original: 'di rnams ni shin tu gtum pa'i gzugs can ma sna tshogs padma'i zla ba la gnas shing /
analyzed: 'di rnams ni shin tu gtum pa'i gzugs can ma sna tshogs padma'i zla ba la gnas shing /
translated: These are in the form of very wrathful women, standing on variegated lotuses and moons.

original: dang po'i phyag dag gis gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin cing /
analyzed: dang po'i phyag dag gis gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin cing /
translated: The first pair of hands hold a flaying knife and a skull-cup.

original: rang dang 'dra ba'i thabs rnams la 'khyud pa /
analyzed: rang dang 'dra ba'i thabs rnams la 'khyud pa /
translated: He embraces the consorts who are like himself.

original: g-yon brkyang bas gnas pa /
analyzed: g-yon brkyang bas gnas pa /
translated: He stands with his left leg straight.

original: zhal gsum pa la gang gi rtsa ba'i zhal sngo ba ni g-yas pa dkar ba'o //
analyzed: zhal gsum pa la gang gi rtsa ba'i zhal sngo ba ni g-yas pa dkar ba'o //
translated: The three faces of the one whose principal face is blue have a right face that is white.

original: g-yon pa dmar ba'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa dmar ba'o //
translated: The left face is red.

original: yang gang gi rtsa ba'i zhal dkar ba de'i zhal g-yas sngo ba'o //
analyzed: yang gang gi rtsa ba'i zhal dkar ba de'i zhal g-yas sngo ba'o //
translated: The one whose principal face is white has a right face that is blue.

original: g-yon pa dmar ba'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa dmar ba'o //
translated: The left face is red.

original: gang gi rtsa ba'i zhal ser ba de'i ni /
analyzed: gang gi rtsa ba'i zhal ser ba de'i ni /
translated: The one whose principal face is yellow has a right face that is

original: g-yas dang g-yon sngo ba dang dkar ba ste /
analyzed: g-yas dang g-yon sngo ba dang dkar ba ste /
translated: blue and a left face that is white.

original: ljang gu dang dmar ba yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ljang gu dang dmar ba yang de bzhin no //
translated: The green and red faces are also like that.

original: grva bzhin gnas pa'i mi'i thod pa rnams ni kha dog dkar po @61b bcud kyis bkang ba'i padma sna tshogs pa'i dbus su gnas pa'o //
analyzed: grva bzhin gnas pa'i mi'i thod pa rnams ni kha dog dkar po @61b bcud kyis bkang ba'i padma sna tshogs pa'i dbus su gnas pa'o //
translated: The human skulls that are located in the four corners are white. They are filled with nectar and are located in the center of various lotuses.

original: de nas ye shes kyi 'khor lo dam tshig gi 'khor lo la bstims te /
analyzed: de nas ye shes kyi 'khor lo dam tshig gi 'khor lo la bstims te /
translated: Then the wisdom wheel dissolves into the commitment wheel.

original: thams cad kyi mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs la de bzhin du thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs byin gyis brlabs nas cho ga ji lta bas dbang bskur te ;
analyzed: thams cad kyi mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs la de bzhin du thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs byin gyis brlabs nas cho ga ji lta bas dbang bskur te ;
translated: Having blessed the eyes, etc. of all, in the same way, having blessed the body, speech, and mind of all, one should confer initiation according to the rite,

original: rjes su mthun par spyi bo la rgyas gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su mthun par spyi bo la rgyas gdab par bya'o //
translated: and one should seal all with the appropriate crown.

original: de nas man ngag ji lta bas mchod pa dang / bstod pa dang / bdud rtsi myang ba'i bar du bya'o //
analyzed: de nas man ngag ji lta bas mchod pa dang / bstod pa dang / bdud rtsi myang ba'i bar du bya'o //
translated: Then, according to the esoteric instructions, one should make offerings and praise up to the tasting of elixir.

original: de nas rang gi snying ga'i ye shes sems dpa'i thugs kar padma la gnas pa'i rdo rje rtse mo lnga pa gyen du 'greng ba zla ba la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de nas rang gi snying ga'i ye shes sems dpa'i thugs kar padma la gnas pa'i rdo rje rtse mo lnga pa gyen du 'greng ba zla ba la gnas pa'o //
translated: Then, in the heart of the gnosis being in one's heart, on a lotus there is a five-tined vajra standing upright, located on a moon.🔽In its center is a moon mandala.

original: de'i lte ba la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de'i lte ba la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: In the center of that is a blue YAṀ.🔽The mantra is:🔽oṃ hrīḥ śrīheruka🔽surata🔽 Translation: Having blessed the eyes, etc. of all, in the same way, having blessed the body, speech, and mind of all, one should confer initiation according to the rite,🔽and one should seal all with the appropriate crown.🔽Then, according to the esoteric instructions, one should make offerings and praise up to the tasting of elixir.🔽Then, in the heart of the gnosis being in one's heart, on a lotus there is a five-tined vajra standing upright, located on a moon.🔽In its center is a moon mandala.

original: de la dbus su yam sngon po nyid de /
analyzed: de la dbus su yam sngon po nyid de /
translated: In the center of that is a blue YAṀ.🔽The mantra is:🔽oṃ hrīḥ śrīheruka

original: aom hr'i: shtri: wi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /🔽zhes pas bskor ba yi ge shin tu phra bas gnas par bltas la /
analyzed: aom hr'i: shtri: wi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /🔽zhes pas bskor ba yi ge shin tu phra bas gnas par bltas la /
translated: surata

original: de las byung ba'i gshin rje'i dgra dbugs la zhon pas 'gro zhing de dang lhan cig 'jug pa gsal bar spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i gshin rje'i dgra dbugs la zhon pas 'gro zhing de dang lhan cig 'jug pa gsal bar spro bar bya'o //
translated: One should visualize that Yama, the enemy arising from that, mounted on the wind, goes forth together with that.

original: gang gi tshe skyo ba na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe skyo ba na /
translated: When one is tired,

original: rus pa'i rang bzhin gyi phreng ba bdud rtsi bcus legs par byugs pa blangs la /
analyzed: rus pa'i rang bzhin gyi phreng ba bdud rtsi bcus legs par byugs pa blangs la /
translated: one should take up a rosary made of bone, well anointed with the nectar of the eight substances.

original: ril bu re re zhing yi ge me yongs su 'gyur ba'i 'dod chags gshin rje'i dgra'i gzugs su rnam par bsam pa'am /
analyzed: ril bu re re zhing yi ge me yongs su 'gyur ba'i 'dod chags gshin rje'i dgra'i gzugs su rnam par bsam pa'am /
translated: One should visualize each bead as the form of Rāgāyaṃ, the enemy Yama, arisen from the transformation of the syllable raṃ.

original: mi'i mgo bo 'phral du bcad pa khrag 'dzag pas khyab par bsams te /
analyzed: mi'i mgo bo 'phral du bcad pa khrag 'dzag pas khyab par bsams te /
translated: Or one should visualize a freshly severed human head, covered with blood.

original: g-yas pa'i mthe bo dang srin lag gis bzung la /
analyzed: g-yas pa'i mthe bo dang srin lag gis bzung la /
translated: One should hold it with the right thumb and ring finger.

original: khro bo'i brjod pa kho nas gsang sngags bzlas pa bya'o //🔽'di la gang gi tshe rim gyis zlos pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: khro bo'i brjod pa kho nas gsang sngags bzlas pa bya'o // 'di la gang gi tshe rim gyis zlos pa de'i tshe /
translated: One should recite the mantra with the recitation of the wrathful one.

original: sa bon yam las zhe sdang gshin rje'i dgra la sogs pa re re lha mo dang bcas par spro ba dang / gsang sngags re re'i yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: sa bon yam las zhe sdang gshin rje'i dgra la sogs pa re re lha mo dang bcas par spro ba dang / gsang sngags re re'i yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: Here, when one recites in sequence, then at that time one should visualize each of the deities, such as Dveṣāyaṃ, the enemy Yama, and so on, arisen from the seed syllable yaṃ, together with the goddess, and complete each mantra.

original: 'on te cig car du ni sa bon yam las kyang zhe sdang gshin rje'i dgra nas /
analyzed: 'on te cig car du ni sa bon yam las kyang zhe sdang gshin rje'i dgra nas /
translated: Or, all at once, from the seed syllable yam, he emanates the wrathful Yamantaka,

original: ji srid mdzod ldan ma gshin rje'i dgra'i bar du dus gcig tu spro zhing /
analyzed: ji srid mdzod ldan ma gshin rje'i dgra'i bar du dus gcig tu spro zhing /
translated: and so on, up to the treasure-holding Yamantaka, and

original: sngags kyang re re yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
analyzed: sngags kyang re re yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
translated: he should also complete each mantra.

original: cig car pa'i phyogs la sku rdo rje la sogs pa yang ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon dang lhan cig spro ba'o //
analyzed: cig car pa'i phyogs la sku rdo rje la sogs pa yang ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon dang lhan cig spro ba'o //
translated: In the case of the all-at-once type, he emanates the vajra body and so on together with the seed syllable of the awareness being.

original: 'dir yang thogs pa dang / shin tu myur ba dang shin tu gsal ba dang / mi gsal ba dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i sngags pas ni grangs 'bum gyi phra mo'i dngos grub tu 'gyur @62a * //
analyzed: 'dir yang thogs pa dang / shin tu myur ba dang shin tu gsal ba dang / mi gsal ba dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i sngags pas ni grangs 'bum gyi phra mo'i dngos grub tu 'gyur @62a * //
translated: Here, the mantra practitioner should avoid the faults of being obstructed, very quick, very clear, unclear, and incorrect imagination, and then he will attain the minor powers of a hundred thousand recitations.

original: ro ; / bye bas ni mkha' la spyod pa'i dbang po phyag rgya chen por gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ro ; / bye bas ni mkha' la spyod pa'i dbang po phyag rgya chen por gnas pa'o //
translated: By ten million recitations, he will attain the state of the great seal of the lord of the sky-farers.

original: de nas bzlas pas yid skyo ba na //
analyzed: de nas bzlas pas yid skyo ba na //
translated: Then, when he is tired of recitation,

original: ye shes 'khor lo mdun na bzhugs pa legs par mchod de /
analyzed: ye shes 'khor lo mdun na bzhugs pa legs par mchod de /
translated: he should make excellent offerings to the wheel of awareness beings who are in front of him.

original: bstod cing bdud rtsi bcu phul la /
analyzed: bstod cing bdud rtsi bcu phul la /
translated: Having praised and offered the nectar,

original: aom a'a: h'um mu: zhes pas gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um mu: zhes pas gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
translated: one should request departure with “Oṃ āḥ hūṃ muḥ.”

original: yang dam tshig 'khor lo bdag nyid kyi yam gi sa bon gyi nang du bcug la /
analyzed: yang dam tshig 'khor lo bdag nyid kyi yam gi sa bon gyi nang du bcug la /
translated: Again, one should place oneself in the seed syllable of yaṃ of the wheel of the pledge beings.

original: bdag nyid zhe sdang gshin rje'i dgra'i ngar 'dzin pa dang gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid zhe sdang gshin rje'i dgra'i ngar 'dzin pa dang gnas par bya'o //
translated: One should remain with the pride of being the wrathful Yamāntaka.

original: thun mtshams bzhi po thams cad du 'di ltar sgrub pa 'di ni /
analyzed: thun mtshams bzhi po thams cad du 'di ltar sgrub pa 'di ni /
translated: This practice in all four sessions is

original: dpal gshin rje dgra'i las rab tu sgrub pa /
analyzed: dpal gshin rje dgra'i las rab tu sgrub pa /
translated: the accomplishment of the activity of glorious Yamāntaka.

original: las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i bya ba'o //
translated: It is the activity of the beginner yogin.

original: gzhan ye shes cung zad babs pa dang / ye shes la dbang thob pa dang / ye shes la yang dag par dbang thob pa rnams kyis bsgrub par bya ba ni le'u bcu bdun pa'i rnam par bshad pa rgya cher 'grel pa 'dir yang ma smras so //
analyzed: gzhan ye shes cung zad babs pa dang / ye shes la dbang thob pa dang / ye shes la yang dag par dbang thob pa rnams kyis bsgrub par bya ba ni le'u bcu bdun pa'i rnam par bshad pa rgya cher 'grel pa 'dir yang ma smras so //
translated: Moreover, the practice of those with a little descent of the wisdom being, those who have attained power over the wisdom being, and those who have attained complete power over the wisdom being is not mentioned in this extensive commentary on the seventeenth chapter.

original: de bzhin du bdud rtsi myang ba dang / gtor ma sbyin pa dag kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdud rtsi myang ba dang / gtor ma sbyin pa dag kyang /
translated: Similarly, the practice of drinking the elixir and offering the bali is not mentioned here.

original: bdag gis le'u gsum pa dang drug pa'i rnam par bshad pa'i skabs su gsal bar byas pa kho nas shes so //
analyzed: bdag gis le'u gsum pa dang drug pa'i rnam par bshad pa'i skabs su gsal bar byas pa kho nas shes so //
translated: One can understand this by the explanation in the third and sixth chapters alone.🔽By the order of the glorious Dharmapala

original: phyogs dbang zla ba zhes grags pa //🔽dpal ldan chos skyong de yi bkas //
analyzed: phyogs dbang zla ba zhes grags pa // dpal ldan chos skyong de yi bkas //
translated: who is known as the moon of the quarter,

original: gshin rje'i dgra gang nag po yi //
analyzed: gshin rje'i dgra gang nag po yi //
translated: the rites for the sadhana of the black Yamantaka

original: sgrub thabs cho ga rnams gsal ba //🔽zla ba'i zer gyis reg pa yis //
analyzed: sgrub thabs cho ga rnams gsal ba // zla ba'i zer gyis reg pa yis //
translated: are clarified.🔽Like a kumuda flower

original: ku mud rab tu rgyas 'dra ba //
analyzed: ku mud rab tu rgyas 'dra ba //
translated: touched by the rays of the moon,

original: 'di ni rnam sbyar dge gang des //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam sbyar dge gang des //
translated: by whatever virtue there is in this composition,

original: 'gro rnams 'chi bdag las rgyal gyur //
analyzed: 'gro rnams 'chi bdag las rgyal gyur //
translated: may all beings conquer the Lord of Death.

original: gshin rje'i dgra nag po'i sgrub pa'i thabs //
analyzed: gshin rje'i dgra nag po'i sgrub pa'i thabs //
translated: The sadhana of the black Yamantaka

original: ku mu da kha bye ba zhes bya ba /🔽slob dpon rin chen 'byung gnas zhi ba'i zhal snga nas kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: ku mu da kha bye ba zhes bya ba / slob dpon rin chen 'byung gnas zhi ba'i zhal snga nas kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: called The Blossoming of the Kumuda Flower🔽is complete.

original: // / a'a ts'arya bi na tsandra dang / lo ts'a ba dge slong chos kyi shes rab kyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o//
analyzed: // / a'a ts'arya bi na tsandra dang / lo ts'a ba dge slong chos kyi shes rab kyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o//
translated: It was translated, edited, and finalized by the Indian abbot Acarya Vinayacandra and the translator-editor Bhikṣu Dharmaśrī.
